title: Chatbot Customer Service Spiral
context: Companies deploy AI chatbots to handle customer support at scale. The math is compelling: a chatbot costs pennies per interaction versus $5-15 for a human agent. First-line resolution rates look good — 60-70% of queries handled without human escalation. But the 30-40% that need a human now face longer queues because the company cut human staff. And the chatbot's confident-but-wrong answers create new support tickets. Customer satisfaction drops. The customers who matter most — high-value, complex-problem customers — are the ones most frustrated.
hypothesis: AI chatbots reduce support costs while maintaining or improving customer satisfaction.

chain.root: Replace front-line customer support with AI chatbots

effects.label: Simple queries resolved, complex queries bottleneck

children.label: Human agent headcount reduced based on chatbot resolution rates
Remaining human queue grows — wait times increase 2-3x
Customers with complex problems forced through chatbot gauntlet first

effects.label: Chatbot generates new support volume
effects.impact: 15-25% of chatbot interactions create follow-up tickets

children.label: Confident wrong answers lead customers down wrong paths
Customers retry with different phrasing, inflating 'resolution' metrics
Frustrated customers call, email, AND chat — multiplying touchpoints

effects.label: Customer satisfaction drops, especially for high-value customers

children.label: High-value customers expect human service and feel devalued
Social media complaints about chatbot experiences go viral
Competitors offering human support gain switching advantage

effects.label: Churn increases among most profitable customer segments
effects.impact: Revenue impact exceeds support cost savings

children.label: Cost savings: $2-5M. Revenue loss from churn: $5-15M
Company re-hires human agents at premium rates to stop bleeding

dontIf: Your competitive advantage depends on customer service quality
Your highest-value customers have complex, nuanced support needs
ifYouMust: Maintain human agent capacity for complex issues — don't cut headcount proportional to chatbot resolution
Provide an obvious, immediate path to a human agent — never trap customers in chatbot loops
Measure actual resolution (customer didn't contact again) not chatbot-reported resolution
Segment by customer value — high-value customers should get human-first support

alternatives.name: AI-assisted human agents
alternatives.note: AI drafts responses and surfaces information, human agent reviews and sends — best of both

alternatives.name: Tiered support by customer value
alternatives.note: Chatbot for self-service, human for high-value — match service level to customer value

alternatives.name: Proactive support
alternatives.note: Use AI to predict and prevent issues rather than react to complaints

falsifiability: Companies replacing front-line support with chatbots maintain or improve CSAT scores over 12 months
High-value customer churn rates remain stable after chatbot deployment
Chatbot-resolved interactions have equal or lower re-contact rates compared to human-resolved interactions

seo.description: AI chatbots cut support costs 95% but drop CSAT 10-20% and increase high-value customer churn 15-25%. The revenue loss from churn often exceeds the cost savings.
